Include details of how the problem is affecting you, and how and when you  already contacted them. You could also say that you will contact your local council for help if you plan to do so. 

You can use one of the letter templates on the [Shelter website](https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/downloads_and_tools/sample_letters)  

It may be helpful to include pictures of the problem. Make sure you keep a record of this letter and the date that you sent it as you may need it in the future. 

## A guide to working with your landlord 
See this detailed guide to working with your landlord on the [Advicenow website](https://www.advicenow.org.uk/know-hows/how-negotiate-your-landlord). 

## Consider making a complaint about a landlord or letting agent

If you are not happy with the way your housing disrepair problem has been dealt with, you can [make a complaint](#) about your landlord or letting agent.

heading: Write to your landlord or letting agent again
lede: If you have written to your landlord or letting agent and they have not responded or not fixed the problem, you should write to them again.
